intro: Sacoglottis holdridgei, commonly known as the Holdridge's sacoglottis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. The species is adapted to thrive in humid, lowland environments with well-drained soils.
